intro: Henriettea lasiostylis, commonly known as the velvet leaf orchid, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and fragrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and prefers well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Its unique floral structure includes spurred petals and a specialized lip that aids in pollination by specific insect species. Henriettea lasiostylis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting native pollinators.
